intro: Rhynchospora fuertesii, commonly known as the Fuertes' spike-rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the wetlands of Central America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and other grass-like plants. The plant features slender, grass-like stems with small, triangular leaves arranged in dense clusters. Its flowering spikes are typically borne at the base of the plant, producing tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Rhynchospora fuertesii thrives in moist to wet environments, such as marshes and pond edges, and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
